intro: Hicorius ovalis var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy oval hibiscus, is a variant of the hibiscus family native to tropical regions. It is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and hairy texture, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of red, pink, or white. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-draining soil. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
